page.title: 11WOODSTOCK FIRE STATION
page.content: The new Woodstock Fire Station stands near the centre of the town. It was built in 1971. The station covers an area of six miles and supports other stations over a ten mile radius. In 1984 they had two hundred emergency calls, of these a number have been traffic accidents from which they rescued a dozen people. They have attended a large variety of calls from burning chip-pans to warehouses and special service calls. The fire men are on duty all the time but they also have other jobs. The sub-officer Mr Williams works in the neaby school as a metalwork teacher. The men are called to the station by a small alerter. The only way the men are restricted is that they have to stay near the fire station in case there is an emergency call.
